Description: Arsenical copper axe-head: crudely fashioned with a deeper cutting end than is usual. The blade is warped and the butt and sides are uneven. It is corroded in parts. The tip of one of the cusps has been flattened by a blow. There are signs of wear on the cutting edge.
Bibliographic references: Davies 1987 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities in the British Museum (107)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
